Articles.Content: Still don't really like the texture of the top of the 2nd stage tank, just me

4, Like IRL

Just noticed that I answered at the same time as BobCat did
I would be more than happy with the blue (not transparent) windows.
There are going to be so menu options for a mobile base with this pack.... Can't wait.
will the LEV be more than one piece? The cockpit and the wheels, so that we can build versions of the SEV?

I would be more than happy with the blue (not transparent) windows.

As would I. The fewer dependent plugins the better.

will the LEV be more than one piece? The cockpit and the wheels,

Pod, Base, and 6 wheels... also maybe back additional energy generator.

so that we can build versions of the SEV?

I dont think so. LER pod have horizontal orientation. Like DEMV Mk1. Hard to make good SEV.

Pod, Base, and 6 wheels... also maybe back additional energy generator.

I dont think so. LER pod have horizontal orientation. Like DEMV Mk1. Hard to make good SEV.

Any plans on recreating the models for the actual LER Mobile Base?

P.S. This is amazing, I've been wanting to use the LER for so long now.

Edited June 11, 2013 by kyle.mk.howard
More compliments

I'm sorry if I missed this, but is the Altair you're making a single-stage reusable lander as opposed to the two-stage configuration most commonly seen? Cause that would be awesome, I've been dying for a good looking reusable lander.
Altair is 2 stage

I'm sorry if I missed this, but is the Altair you're making a single-stage reusable lander as opposed to the two-stage configuration most commonly seen? Cause that would be awesome, I've been dying for a good looking reusable lander.

What? Single stage double stage... i dont understand. All be work like IRL,.... exept ATHLETE system.

No problem with non-transparent LER, it's KSP after all. LER wasn't even transparent in 'Moonbase Alpha'.

EDIT: Kvant and other Mir modules are not exactly to scale. It can be fixed by setting rescaleFactor on Kvant-1 to 1.1268 and on TKS based modules to 0.9122 - this makes the diameter of docking compartment on TKS based modules the same as the diameter of Kvant-1, which is ~1.048 of Core module diameter, just as IRL.

Edited June 11, 2013 by m4ti140
Ideally the windows would be silvered, to reduce heat exchange, but meh. Still awesome! I am drooling for a release.

EDIT: Just watched the video and answered my own question, it's a two-stage. Foo. I guess maybe I could do some .cfg edits to turn it into a reusable lander though.

What? Single stage double stage... i dont understand. All be work like IRL,.... exept ATHLETE system.

Single stage as in one engine, one set of tanks. Most of the mock-ups of the Altair lander show a descent stage and a separate ascent stage. (pictured below) However all those show a vertical cabin, yours has a horizontal cabin that looks more like the much later designs near the cancelation of the Constellation program that use a single stage reusable lander that would stay attached to a lunar orbiting station when not on the surface.

Edited June 11, 2013 by spawnofbill

I would be more than happy with the blue (not transparent) windows.

Same here BobCat if it matters. Either way it's a fantastic looking craft. Looking forward to flying her.

EDIT: Just watched the video and answered my own question, it's a two-stage. Foo. I guess maybe I could do some .cfg edits to turn it into a reusable lander though.

Single stage as in one engine, one set of tanks. Most of the mock-ups of the Altair lander show a descent stage and a separate ascent stage. (pictured below) However all those show a vertical cabin, yours has a horizontal cabin that looks more like the much later designs near the cancelation of the Constellation program that use a single stage reusable lander that would stay attached to a lunar orbiting station when not on the surface.

Unfortunately I don't have many sources, but from what I remember, the Horizontal cabin (what bobcat is making) was the earlier design, and the Vertical Cabin is the later design. Not saying they didn't redesign it yet again right before cancellation though

The vertical cabin lander was the latest Constellation design reference.

The horizontal cabin that Bobcat has modelled was from the old ESAS/VSE study from 2004, before Constellation.
Actually, horizontal cabin was included in early Constellation drafts. And yes, it was a separate ascent stage.

I think it has 4 like the real one. Not sure.

Well, technically it can't be like real one since there was no real one

Well, technically it can't be like real one since there was no real one

Well like the one that its final designs said it will look like.

Unfortunately I don't have many sources, but from what I remember, the Horizontal cabin (what bobcat is making) was the earlier design, and the Vertical Cabin is the later design. Not saying they didn't redesign it yet again right before cancellation though

The constant redesigns were one of the contributing factors to why CxP was cancelled.

This pack looks amazing. Hopefully I will get a chance to see the LER/SER and mockup Orion this summer.
